questions.text: Among the following options, which CYP is involved in the metabolism of most drugs is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

CYP3A4

Highyeild:

Most abundantly expressed in liver It is involved in the metabolism of over 50% of clinically used drugs CYP3A4/5 Carryout biotransformation of the largest number (nearly 50%) of drugs. In addition to the liver, these isoforms are expressed in the intestine (responsible for first-pass metabolism at this site) and kidney as well. Inhibition of this isoenzyme by erythromycin, clarithromycin, ketoconazole, and itraconazole is responsible for the important drug interaction with terfenadine, astemizole, and cisapride which are its substrates. Verapamil, ritonavir, and a constituent of grapefruit juice are another important inhibitor

CYP2C9: is an enzyme protein. The enzyme is involved in the metabolism, by oxidation, of both xenobiotics, including drugs, and endogenous compounds, including fatty acids. In humans, the protein is encoded by the CYP2C9 gene Option: D. CYP1A1 : family 1, subfamily A, polypeptide 1 is a protein that in humans is encoded by the CYP1A1 gene. The protein is a member of the cytochrome P450 superfamily of enzymes
